```lean4
import Mathlib

open Topology Filter

/--
Let $C$ be the set of continuous functions $f : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$. Let $T : C \to C$ satisfty the following two properties:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Linearity: $T(af + bg) = aT(f) + bT(g)$ for all $a, b \in \mathbb{R}$ and all $f, g \in C$.
\item Locality: If $f \in C$ and $g \in C$ are identical on some interval $I$, then $T(f)$ and $T(g)$ are also identical on $I$.
\end{enumerate}
Prove that there exists some function $f \in C$ such that $T(g(x)) = f(x)g(x)$ for all $g \in C$.
-/
theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g := by
  use fun x => 0
  constructor
  · rw [hC]
    exact continuous_const
  intro g hg
  have h1 := linearT 0 0 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  have h2 := linearT 1 0 (fun x => 1) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const)
  have h3 := linearT 0 1 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  have h4 := linearT 1 1 (fun x => 1) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  simp at h1 h2 h3 h4
  <;> funext x
  <;> simp_all [Pi.zero_apply, Pi.one_apply, mul_zero, zero_mul, mul_one, mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm]
  <;> aesop
```

(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g := by
  use fun x => 0
  have h₀ : Continuous (fun x : ℝ => (0 : ℝ)) := continuous_const
  refine' ⟨h₀, _⟩
  intro g hg
  have h₁ := localT 0 0 (by norm_num) (fun x => 0) (by simpa [hC] using h₀) g h₀ hg
  have h₂ := h₁
  simp at h₂
  have h₃ := linearT 1 0 (fun x => 0) (by simpa [hC] using h₀) g hg
  simp at h₃
  have h₄ := linearT 0 1 g hg (fun x => 0) (by simpa [hC] using h₀)
  simp at h₄
  simp_all
  <;> aesop
```

theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))

import Mathlib

open Topology Filter

/--
Let $C$ be the set of continuous functions $f : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$. Let $T : C \to C$ satisfty the following two properties:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Linearity: $T(af + bg) = aT(f) + bT(g)$ for all $a, b \in \mathbb{R}$ and all $f, g \in C$.
\item Locality: If $f \in C$ and $g \in C$ are identical on some interval $I$, then $T(f)$ and $T(g)$ are also identical on $I$.
\end{enumerate}
Prove that there exists some function $f \in C$ such that $T(g(x)) = f(x)g(x)$ for all $g \in C$.
-/

(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})

(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g := by
  use fun x => 0
  have h₀ : (fun x : ℝ => (0 : ℝ)) ∈ C := by
    rw [hC]
    exact continuous_const
  constructor
  · exact h₀
  · intro g hg
    have h₁ : T g = (fun x => 0) * g := by
      have h₂ : T g ∈ C := imageTC g hg
      rw [hC] at h₂
      have h₃ : Continuous (T g) := h₂
      have h₄ : Continuous g := hg
      have h₅ : T g = (fun x => 0) * g := by
        ext x
        have h₆ : T (fun x => 0) = (fun x => 0) := by
          have h₇ : (fun x => 0) ∈ C := by
            rw [hC]
            exact continuous_const
          have h₈ : T (fun x => 0) ∈ C := imageTC (fun x => 0) h₇
          rw [hC] at h₈
          have h₉ : Continuous (T (fun x => 0)) := h₈
          have h₁₀ : T (fun x => 0) = (fun x => 0) := by
            apply localT (-1) 1 (by norm_num) (fun x => 0) (by simp [hC, continuous_const]) (fun x => 0) (by simp [hC, continuous_const])
            intro x hx
            simp_all
          simp_all
        have h₁₁ : T g x = (fun x => 0) x * g x := by
          have h₁₂ : T g = (fun x => 0) * g := by
            apply localT (-1) 1 (by norm_num) g hg (fun x => 0) (by simp [hC, continuous_const])
            intro x hx
            simp_all
          simp_all
        simp_all
      simp_all
    simp_all

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_a5
(C : Set (ℝ → ℝ))
(hC : C = {f : ℝ → ℝ | Continuous f})
(T : (ℝ → ℝ) → (ℝ → ℝ))
(imageTC : ∀ f ∈ C, T f ∈ C)
(linearT : ∀ a b : ℝ, ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T ((fun x => a)*f + (fun x => b)*g) = (fun x => a)*(T f) + (fun x => b)*(T g))
(localT : ∀ r s : ℝ, r ≤ s → ∀ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, f x = g x) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc r s, T f x = T g x))
: ∃ f ∈ C, ∀ g ∈ C, T g = f * g := by
  use (fun x => 0)
  constructor
  · rw [hC]
    exact continuous_const
  intro g hg
  have h1 := linearT 0 0 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  have h2 := linearT 1 0 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  have h3 := linearT 0 1 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  have h4 := linearT 1 1 (fun x => 0) (by rw [hC]; exact continuous_const) g hg
  simp at h1 h2 h3 h4
  funext x
  simp_all
  <;> aesop
